alert.note: Alert for Graham (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 01 at 3:46AM CST until February 03 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, with locally higher accumulations possible. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Graham County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight Wednesday night to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions due to snowpacked roads and freezing temperatures. Patchy blowing snow could reduce visibility at times. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
